evidences.text: Oct 9, 2023 07:35 IST Six people were killed and 27 others were injured after a bus plunged into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Nainital district on Sunday, news agency PTI reported. evidences.text: The traffic movement on the Badrinath highway in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district was blocked after stones rolled off a hill near Baba Ashram Karnaprayag, reported ANI citing officials. Traffic was temporarily suspended after stones slipped down the hill in Karnaprayag town of Chamoli, district police said. On Saturday, a portion of the Badrinath National Highway (NH-7) was damaged as the water level of the Lambagad drain rose due to the heavy showers in the Chamoli since Friday night, ANI mentioned. A 50-metre stretch was washed away after incessant rainfall.

evidences.text: Background Disaster struck Uttarakhand’s Chamoli District on 7 February 2021, when a massive flash flood ravaged through the valleys of the Rishi Ganga, Dhauliganga and Alaknanda rivers. More than 70 people have been confirmed dead and another 134 people reported missing . The flood swept away the unfinished Tapovan Vishnugad Hydropower Project and inflicted substantial damage on the Rishi Ganga Hydropower Project. Even as rescue and relief efforts were underway, a glacial lake outburst flood (GLOF) was suggested as the reason for the flood, possibly triggered by glacier collapse.
evidences.query: What were the consequences of the collapse on NH-707A near Chamoli district in Uttarakhand on April 23, 2018?

evidences.text: Please try again later {{ /verifyErrors }} The drivers of a passenger train that rammed into a stationary locomotive in the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh in October last year were “distracted” watching a cricket match on the phone. The crash resulted in the death of at least 14 people. The ramming caused three coaches to derail and led to the death of at least 14 and injuries to dozens of passengers. Railways minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told the Press Trust of India: “The recent case in Andhra Pradesh happened because both the loco pilot and co-pilot were distracted by the cricket match which was going on.”

In which year did Ritika Singh make her film debut in "Settai," an Indian film?
Which film, starring Ritika Singh, was released under the title "Settai" in India?
Which reality TV show did Ritika Singh gain recognition on before starring in Indian films?
Which sport-themed Indian film did Ritika Singh star in alongside Madhavan, titled "Saala Khadoos"?

evidences.text: Ritika Singhis a talented Indian actress and mixed martial artist known for her work predominantly in Tamil and Hindi cinema. Her journey from being a national-level kickboxer to a successful actress is a testament to her versatility and dedication. Ritika’s early life was marked by her passion for sports, particularly kickboxing. She achieved remarkable success in the field, winning several championships and accolades at a young age.
evidences.query: In which Indian state did Ritika Singh, the Indian actress and martial artist, gain recognition as a contestant on the reality TV show "Super Dancer"?

evidences.text: In 2001, movie named Settai got released in which Pandiarajan acted as Hero. Hence, there was little controversy over the title. UTV Motion Pictures have produced this movie. UTV’s last 2 Tamil movies – Mugamoodi & Thandavam didn’t do well at the Box Office.
evidences.query: In which year did Ritika Singh make her film debut in "Settai," an Indian film?

evidences.text: Running time 136 minutes Country India Language Tamil Settai ( transl. Mischief ) is a 2013 Indian Tamil -language black comedy film directed by R. Kannan . [1] A remake of the 2011 Bollywood English-language film, Delhi Belly , [2] it stars Arya , Hansika Motwani , Anjali , Santhanam and Premji . [3] The film, which began filming in Chennai on 7 May 2012, [4] released for April 2013.
evidences.query: Which film, starring Ritika Singh, was released under the title "Settai" in India?

evidences.text: [6] For her performance in Irudhi Suttru , Ritika won the Special Mention at the 63rd National Film Awards and became the first actress who did not dub for her role to be recognised at the National Awards. [7] Singh later appeared in Manikandan 's Aandavan Kattalai , which was released in September 2016. [8] Her next film is the Telugu movie Guru (2017), a remake of Irudhi Suttru . [9] Later, she performed in the horror comedy P. Vasu 's Shivalinga (2017) and the Telugu movie Neevevaro (2018).
evidences.query: Which reality TV show did Ritika Singh gain recognition on before starring in Indian films?

evidences.text: Final round ) is a 2016 Indian sports drama film written and directed by Sudha Kongara . Filmed simultaneously in Tamil and Hindi , with the latter being titled as Saala Khadoos ( transl. Bloody Grouch ), the film stars R. Madhavan as boxing coach who is ignored by the boxing association, tries to accomplish his dream by training an amateur boxer, Madhi, played by Ritika Singh in her acting debut. Kongara wrote the script for the film in early 2011, and approached Madhavan for the leading role, for whom the film marks his comeback to Tamil cinema after four years.
evidences.query: Which sport-themed Indian film did Ritika Singh star in alongside Madhavan, titled "Saala Khadoos"?
